      Return affected range, without non-internal newlines we consider '\n' not as a part of line, but a separator between lines ex: if last line is not empty, the last symbol will not be '\n'

      • getLinesRange

        public static TextRange getLinesRange(Document document,
                                      int line1,
                                      int line2)
        Return affected range, without non-internal newlines

        we consider '\n' not as a part of line, but a separator between lines ex: if last line is not empty, the last symbol will not be '\n'

      • getLinesRange

      • getOffset

        public static int getOffset(Document document,
                            int line,
                            int column)

      • getLineCount

        public static int getLineCount(Document document)
        Document.getLineCount() returns 0 for empty text.

        This breaks an assumption "getLineCount() == StringUtil.countNewLines(text) + 1" and adds unnecessary corner case into line ranges logic.

      • getLines

      • markDirtyAndRefresh

        public static void markDirtyAndRefresh(boolean async,
                                       boolean recursive,
                                       boolean reloadChildren,
                                       VirtualFile... files)
        Difference with VfsUtil.markDirtyAndRefresh(boolean, boolean, boolean, com.intellij.openapi.vfs.VirtualFile...) is that refresh from VfsUtil will be performed with ModalityState.NON_MODAL.
